intro: Neoporteria vallenarensis var. transitensis, commonly known as the Transient Neoporteria, is a rare flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Chile. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is adapted to the temperate maritime climate of its native habitat. Its leaves are narrow and slightly succulent, helping it conserve moisture in its arid coastal environment. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
